full_text.0: Iowans seeking treatment for opioid use disorder can start searching at https://t.co/2leZec64Bv.
full_text.1: Today, I joined a bipartisan coalition of AGs urging the FDA to permanently allow doctors to use telemedicine services to prescribe buprenorphine to patients with opioid use disorder. The ability to easily access treatment is vital as we continue to fight the opioid epidemic.
full_text.2: During the pandemic, the FDA allowed doctors to use telehealth services to prescribe buprenorphine, an opioid use disorder treatment, to patients. With the COVID-19 public health emergency set to end, these services will cease, cutting off more than 2.5M people from treatment.
full_text.3:
Our settlement with Walmart will provide more than $19.9 million to Iowa and will require significant improvements in how the retailer's pharmacies handle opioids.  

"Walmart agrees to $3.1 billion settlement with Iowa and other states" https://t.co/qIC6tlJjIA via @DMRegister

full_text.5: @Timcast I agree on some level. I do think he is too broadly speaking. I do know that Thailand got rid of their opioid problem overnight when the king implemented their zero tolerance, execution on sight for anyone selling, dealing, manufacturing, assembling, trafficking opioids. FWIW

full_text.7: WHO RADIO NEWS: Iowa to get Nearly $20 Million in Walmart Opioid Settlement https://t.co/42ZPCKWCIG
full_text.8: Iowa part of opioid settlement with Walmart https://t.co/ba8YNn2AlU
full_text.9: Walmart agreed to the framework of a $3.1 billion settlement, which resolves allegations from multiple states' attorneys general that the company failed to regulate opioid prescriptions contributing to the nationwide opioid crisis. https://t.co/nIV9cRAmzn
full_text.10:
We're happy that Manchester's Regional Medical Center has joined the Billion Pill Pledge program to prevent opioid addiction before it begins. 

Read more about the program here: 
https://t.co/00OGfxcbl5 https://t.co/DuxUMnSh9c
full_text.11: This deal adds to the important progress we've already achieved. It provides meaningful resources to help people suffering from opioid addiction get the treatment and recovery services they need. It also changes the way pharmacies operate, ensuring that this never happens again.
full_text.12:
Too many lives have been lost or devastated by the opioid epidemic. 

Today, we've announced that Walmart will pay $3.1 billion dollars for its part in fueling the opioid crisis. Iowa will receive $19.9 million to address the epidemic in our state. 

https://t.co/eUDVyjlLrX
full_text.13: Walmart latest pharmacy chain to propose opioid settlement https://t.co/4m0y2yh0SA
full_text.14: The tally of proposed and finalized settlements in recent years is more than $50 billion, with most of that to be used by governments. https://t.co/1kKHorvlpr
